title: Netflix renews House Of Cards for a fifth season but lose Beau Willimon
title_page: Netflix renews House Of Cards for a fifth season but lose Beau Willimon | Daily Mail Online
text:
While a renewal is a big win for fans, it seems as though not all the news was positive out of Netflix on Thursday.
The streaming service announced an early renewal for a fifth season of the award winning drama House of Cards, but simultaneously revealed that showrunner Beau Willimon, 38, would be exiting the show.
While no reason was given for his departure, a source told The Hollywood Reporter that Willimon is set to work on an original play.
More to come: House Of Cards has been given an early renewal for a fifth season by Netflix
The split seemed amicable enough, and he opted not to mention any specific reason for leaving in a statement he released Thursday.
'I'm grateful to Netflix and Media Rights Capital, my fellow executive producers, our two incandescent stars Kevin Spacey and Robin Wright, our talented writers, as well as the incredible cast and crew with whom I've had the privilege to work.'
'After five years and four seasons, it's time for me to move on to new endeavors, but I'm supremely proud of what we've built together, wish the show much continued success, and leave it in the hands of a very capable team.'
The streaming giant concurrently released it's own very complimentary statement.
